intro: Escobedia obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaved escobedia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native desert environment. Escobedia obtusifolia is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry conditions.
